Edukapp provides a JSON API that can be used to create the user interface.

= Introduction =



= GET /featured=

Gets the list of featured widgets.

Example:

{{{
[
 {
 "id":1251,
 "name":"ShareDraw",
  "type":"W3C Widget",
  "featured":1,
  "uri":"http://wookie.apache.org/widgets/sharedraw",
  "tags":[],
  "activities":[]
 },
 {
  "id":1252,
  "name":"Butterfly",
  "type":"W3C Widget",
  "featured":1,
  "uri":"http://wookie.apache.org/widgets/butterfly",
  "tags":[
    {"id":1,"tagtext":"test tag text"},
    {"id":2,"tagtext":"test tag text"}
  ],
  "activities":[]
 }
]
}}}

= GET /search?q={search terms} =

Search for widgets matching the search terms.

Example:

{{{
GET /search?q=chat
}}}

= GET /similar?uri={widget uri}=

Search for similar widgets to the widget identified with the uri parameter.

Example:

{{{
GET /similar?uri=http%3A%2F%2Fwookie.apache.org%2Fwidgets%2Fsimplechat
}}}

Returns:

{{{
[
  {
  "id":1153,
  "name":"Natter",
  "type":"W3C Widget",
  "featured":0,
  "uri":"http://www.getwookie.org/widgets/natter",
  "tags":[],
  "activities":[]
  }
]
}}}

= GET /review?uri={widget uri} =

Get user reviews for the specified widget.


Example:

{{{
GET /review?uri=http%3A%2F%2Fwookie.apache.org%2Fwidgets%2Fsimplechat
}}}

Returns:

{{{
[
  {
  "id":1,
  "text":"TEST",
  "rating":3,
  "time":"2012-02-14T10:20:01.000+0000",
  "user":"scott"
  }
]
}}}

= GET /widget?id={widget id}=

Get the specified widget profile


= GET /widget?uri={widget uri}=

Get the specified widget profile
